heading: Let's get started
body: Are you seeking information for yourself or for someone else?

heading: Let's see what we can do for you.
body: In what country do you have citizenship?

heading: You are a United States citizen.
body: Dope! You're good to go!

heading: You have Mexican citizenship.
body: Have any deporation proceedings (including arrest) been initiated against you?

heading: We're sorry.
body: This app is not ready to handle your situation just yet. To find someone who can help you, contact someone from theJustice For Our Neighbors directory.

heading: It's important to be prepared.
body: Are you making arrangements for any children currently living in the United States?

heading: There are multiple children.
body: Which of the following best describes your plans for the children?
button1name: I want them to stay in the United States.
button2name: I want them to be able to travel to and from Mexico.

heading: Alright.
body: Do all of your children in the United States have the same citizenship status?

heading: You're making arrangements for one child.
body: Is this child younger than 18 years old?

body: Which of the following best describes your plans for this child?
button1name: I want the child to stay in the United States.
button2name: I want the child to be able to travel to and from Mexico.

heading: We can help.
body: What is the child's citizenship status?

heading: Your child is a citizen of the United States.

body: Is this your biological child?

heading: We've got a few questions about you and the child's other parent.
body: In what country does the child's other parent have citizenship?

heading: Both parents have Mexican citizenship.
body: Were either you or the child's other parent naturalized Mexican citizens, or were you both born Mexican citizens?

heading: Just a few more questions.
body: Were you and the child's other parent granted a Mexican marriage license before the child's birth?

body: Does the child have any siblings with Mexican citizenship?
